approaches.name: Sliding Window (Optimal)
approaches.intuition: Instead of recalculating sum for each window of size k, slide the window by removing leftmost element and adding new rightmost element. This reduces time from O(n*k) to O(n). Maintain running sum and update maximum.
approaches.approach: Calculate sum of first k elements. Then slide window: subtract arr[i-k], add arr[i], update max. Single pass through array.

approaches.name: Brute Force
approaches.intuition: Calculate sum for every possible window of size k. Check all starting positions from 0 to n-k. For each position, sum k elements. Track maximum sum seen.
approaches.approach: Nested loops: outer loop for window start position, inner loop to calculate sum of k elements. Update max after each window.

complexity.timeExplanation: Outer loop runs (n-k+1) times. Inner loop runs k times. Total: O(n*k).
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only storing sum variables. Constant space.

commonMistakes: Forgetting to check if array size < k
Off-by-one error in loop: using i < n instead of i <= n-k
Not initializing maxSum with first window sum
Integer overflow when dealing with large sums
Modifying original array instead of using window sum
Wrong index calculation: arr[i-k] vs arr[i-k+1]
Using wrong loop bounds causing array out of bounds
